decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Site Location Plan, Cross Over Plans and Proposed Site Plan

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - Hours of Use - The use hereby permitted shall operate only between the hours of 09.00 and 22.00 Monday - Saturday only.
Condition : 5 - Restriction on Music/Amplified Sound - No music or other amplified sound generated on the premises shall be audible at the boundary of any adjacent residential building.
Condition : 6 - No External Lighting - No external lighting shall be installed without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - No refuse or waste material of any description shall be left or stored anywhere on the site other than within a building or refuse enclosure. 
REASON: To safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area.
Condition : 8 - Staff on Premises - No staff shall be present on the premises 1 hour/s after closing time of the use hereby approved.

Condition : 9 - Cycle Parking to be implemented - Four (4) cycle parking spaces shall be provided and made available for use prior to commencmeent of the use hereby approved.  These facilities shall be retained for the occupants of and visitors to the development at all times.

Condition : 10 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) additional information was submitted at the request of the Case OFficer to make the scheme acceptable 
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
subdivision_of_building: Small section of previously developed rear car park

application_details.lead_developer_company_name: The applicant/Merton Council as public/private partnership

description: PART CHANGE OF USE OF CAR PARK TO USE CLASS F1 AND ERECTION OF A PRACTICE RAILWAY TRACK TO FACILITATE RAILWAY MAINTENANCE TRAINING.
